intro: Spergularia heterosperma, commonly known as the sea sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb that thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid conditions. Spergularia heterosperma is often found in dunes and saline soils, showcasing its ability to tolerate harsh, coastal climates.
